New Records: Rachin Ravindra scored 565 runs, moving him atop the scoring charts
Mitchell Santner took 2-22 in a spell of 10 straight overs
Key Match Events: The Black Caps took five wickets in the first 10 overs
Trent Boult became the first New Zealander to collect 50 World Cup scalps
Rachin Ravindra and Devon Conway formed an 86-run opening stand
Mitchell Santner completed a spell of 10 straight overs
Mitchell (43 off 31) came out cracking boundaries to make it 103-2 after 15
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand had battled through injuries and a four-game losing streak
They needed only 23.2 overs to advance to another knockout round
Williamson was able to select from a full squad and deploy a well-balanced bowling unit firing at the right time
Post-Match Reflections: The Black Caps made quick work of their chase
Victory — and almost certainly a semifinal berth — was soon secured
New Zealand will now face one of the toughest tests in cricket against India
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be a repeat of the epic two-day semifinal in 2019
Sri Lanka's tailenders decided to dig in, with Maheesh Theekshana (38no off 91) forming the two longest partnerships of the innings
What Pakistan must do to reach semifinals, and deny the Black Caps
Afghanistan need to win by at least 438 runs against South Africa to jump the Black Caps on NRR
Others: Rain was a possibility but eventually did not affect the match significantly
